data.title: Upside Down Medicine by Racey Helps
data.meta_description: The Upside-Down Medicine (a Barnaby Littlemouse Book) by Racey Helps and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.co.uk.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Poor. No Jacket. Some page tanning and sporadic foxing, some pages with tape repairs; owner's name in pencil on front endpaper, backstrip is missing and tape repair to spine, covers very worn and rubbed with area loss to surface of front cover. No wrapper. Still a sound reading copy.

Original Cloth. Condition: Good. Helps, Racey (illustrator). Second Impression. Second impression from 1948 of a book first published by Collins in 1946. Illustrated boards have rubbing, edgewear and some surface wear. Spine strip has been replaced at some point and is beginning to come away from the spine at top and bottom. Page edges are browned and some small marks to pages which are generally unmarked. No jacket.

Hardback. Condition: Very Good. No Jacket. Helps, Racey (illustrator). 2nd 1948. Almost very good condition with no wrapper. A Barnaby Littlemouse Book. Small oblong format. Pictorial paper boards. Pictorial endpapers. Colour illustrations. Spine and corners bumped and worn. Old tape marks to spine edges and spine has been relaid. Foxing to covers. Packaged with care and promptly dispatched!.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. No Jacket. Repr. Hardback: full page colour illustrations by the author, no dj, colour pictorial covers are lightly marked and rubbed, corners are bumped and worn, spine covering is missing, name on the front flyleaf and title page, internal foxing and a few other marks, the front edge of 2 pages is creased, still g. obl 8vo, 48pp.

Hardcover. Condition: Fair. No Jacket. A Barnaby Littlemouse Book. Pictoral cover shows shelf wear, rubbing, bumped corners, spine cover missing but netting holding, back cover creased. Child's name in pencil on front endpaper. Mild dirt marks thoughout. A story of the adventures of a mouse and other small creatures. Well illustrated by author throughout.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. 1946. A lightly used copy, with a few knocks and bumps at the outer corners, including a repair to splits at the base of the spine, internally well-presented with no major creases and just some slight browning at the outer page edges. Why on Amazon do most sellers not describe their actual book? Buy with confidence and support a genuine Independent Bricks & Mortar Real Bookshop. We are Maynard & Bradley CAMBO & PBFA(now lapsed) members here in Leicester City Centre Size: 180 x 150 mm. 48. Item Type: Book. Quantity Available: 1. Shipped Weight: Under 500 grams. Category: Children; Britain/UK; 1940s; Inventory No: 43701.

First UK edition. Landscape octavo; hardcover, with illustrated boards and decorative endpapers; 48pp., with many colour illustrations. Moderate wear; covers rubbed and edgeworn; bumping to the corners and the spine extremities; repaired spine; some old tape stains and small surface tears; text block edges toned; minor offset to the endpapers; scattered foxing throughout; some minor marks; some coloured pencil scribbles to page 46. No dustwrapper. Good. Postage quoted is for a standard format octavo book. Final charges may vary depending on size and weight. Author's second book.

Pictorial boards. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: No dj. First Edition. Sound tight decent copy, free of markings, backstrip intact with slight weasr to base, some brown mottling to front panel, not too detracting and oly affecting highlights. Colour endpapers and title page have overall foxing freckles, pages inside clean and bright. Green rear panel nice and clean with three small white specks. Overall slight bow to boards. A well above average copy for condition. Size: 12mo.

Hard Cover. Condition: Very Good to Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Good Plus. A very good to fine hardcover picturecover in a good plus jacket. Jacket has pieces torn off on bottom edges, and some crease marks on edges, Cover illustration nice. Pages are clean and bright. No date (about 1946) A Barnaby Littlemouse Book.

Soft Cover. Condition: Good. HELPS, Racey (illustrator). Uncommon title in the Barnaby Littlemouse series. Pictoral finished card covers with black and red lettering to front. Boards are rather worn but still serviceable. Corners are bumped, edges are worn. Spine is holding well but the paper covering has all been lost. Some slight fox to the endpages. Textblock has one or two grubby marks but is generally clean. Childish scribble to the edge of p15 and a drawing to the final blank. 48 pp. Additional photos are available upon request. When securely packed this item will weigh in the region of 278g. All our books are photographed so you can see what you are buying. ABE may, however, display a stock image whilst processing ours. (YBP Ref: 030168:5e) Size: 24mo - over 5" - 53/4" tall 278 G. Book.
